wikipedia.title: Clapping
wikipedia.summary: A clap is the percussive sound made by striking together two flat surfaces, as in the body parts of humans or animals.

wikipedia.title: Bias against left-handed people
wikipedia.summary: Bias based on handedness is bias or design, conscious or not, usually against people who are left-handed.

blogs.title: 15 Corker Cricket Terms, Deciphered
blogs.summary: On May 6, 1751, the first U.S. cricket match was recorded. In honor of that game, and to decipher some of the seemingly complex intricacies for the uninitiated, check out these 15 corker cricket terms.

q&a.title: "VIP" and the acronym fad of the '30s.
q&a.summary:
VIP, the acronym for Very Important Person, is from the 1930s, a boom decade for initialisms, according to www.wordorigins.org.

Both Etymonline and the The Dictionary of American Slang say that its earliest usage was in  1933. The usage instance they are

facebook.title: A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English
facebook.summary: Your entry for 'As thick as two short planks' dates it from the 1970s. Eric Partridge gives it as forces' slang, c 1950 - see https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=IAjyQdFwh4UC&pg=PA894&lpg=PA894&dq=as+thick+as+14+short+planks&source=bl&ots=_2SzjInQ4E&sig=aA
